action.action-desc: Mr. Smith of New Jersey introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on the Judiciary

form.official-title: For the relief of Osmark Juan Bruemmer Gonzalez.

section.header: Permanent resident status for Osmark Juan Bruemmer Gonzalez

subsection.text: Notwithstanding subsections (a) and (b) of section 201 of the Immigration and Nationality Act, Osmark Juan Bruemmer Gonzalez shall be eligible for issuance of an immigrant visa or for adjustment of status to that of an alien lawfully admitted for permanent residence upon filing an application for issuance of an immigrant visa under section 204 of such Act or for adjustment of status to lawful permanent resident.

If Osmark Juan Bruemmer Gonzalez enters the United States before the filing deadline specified in subsection (c), he shall be considered to have entered and remained lawfully and shall, if otherwise eligible, be eligible for adjustment of status under section 245 of the Immigration and Nationality Act as of the date of the enactment of this Act.

subsection.header: Deadline for application and payment of fees
subsection.text: Subsections (a) and (b) shall apply only if the application for issuance of an immigrant visa or the application for adjustment of status is filed with appropriate fees within 2 years after the date of the enactment of this Act.

Upon the granting of an immigrant visa or permanent residence to Osmark Juan Bruemmer Gonzalez, the Secretary of State shall instruct the proper officer to reduce by 1, during the current or next following fiscal year, the total number of immigrant visas that are made available to natives of the country of the alien’s birth under section 203(a) of the Immigration and Nationality Act or, if applicable, the total number of immigrant visas that are made available to natives of the country of the alien’s birth under section 202(e) of such Act.

subsection.header: Denial of preferential immigration treatment for certain relatives
subsection.text: The natural parents, brothers, and sisters of Osmark Juan Bruemmer Gonzalez shall not, by virtue of such relationship, be accorded any right, privilege, or status under the Immigration and Nationality Act.
